010package imagingbook.lib.ij;
011
012import java.nio.file.Path;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014import java.util.Comparator;
015import java.util.LinkedList;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Objects;
018
019import ij.ImagePlus;
020import ij.WindowManager;
021import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
022import ij.io.OpenDialog;
023import ij.io.Opener;
024import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
025import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
026import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
027import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
028import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
029import imagingbook.lib.util.bits.BitMap;
030
031
032/**
033 * TODO: Clarify assumed arrangement of 2D arrays!
034 * @author WB
035 *
036 */
037public abstract class IjUtils {
038        
039        /**
040         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of ImagePlus objects that are
041         * sorted by their titles if the 'sortByTitle' flag is set.
042         * 
043         * @param sortByTitle flag, result is sorted if true.
044         * @return an array of currently open images.
045         */
046        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle) {
047                return getOpenImages(sortByTitle, null);
048        }
049        
050
051        /**
052         * Returns an array of strings containing the short titles
053         * of the images supplied.
054         * 
055         * @param images array of images.
056         * @return array of names.
057         */
058        public static String[] getImageShortTitles(ImagePlus[] images) {
059                String[] imageNames = new String[images.length];
060                for (int i = 0; i < images.length; i++) {
061                        imageNames[i] = images[i].getShortTitle();
062                }
063                return imageNames;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Opens a dialog to let the user select one of the currently open images.
068         * @param title string to show in the dialog
069         * @return An ImagePlus object, use the getProcessor method to obtain the associated ImageProcessor
070         */
071        public static ImagePlus selectOpenImage(String title) {
072                ImagePlus[] openImages = getOpenImages(true, null);
073                String[] imageNames = getImageShortTitles(openImages);
074                if (title == null) {
075                        title = "image:";
076                }
077                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Select image");
078                gd.addChoice(title, imageNames, imageNames[0]);
079                gd.showDialog(); 
080                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
081                        return null;
082                else {
083                        return openImages[gd.getNextChoiceIndex()];
084                }
085        }
086        
087        
088        /**
089         * Returns a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects that are
090         * sorted by their titles if the sortByTitle flag is set.
091         * The image "exclude" (typically the current image) is not included 
092         * in the returned array (pass null to exclude no image).
093         * 
094         * @param sortByTitle set {@code true} to return images sorted by title
095         * @param exclude reference to an image to be excluded (may be {@code null})
096         * @return a (possibly empty) array of {@link ImagePlus} objects
097         */
098        public static ImagePlus[] getOpenImages(boolean sortByTitle, ImagePlus exclude) {
099                List<ImagePlus> imgList = new LinkedList<ImagePlus>();
100                int[] wList = WindowManager.getIDList();
101        if (wList != null) {
102                for (int i : wList) {
103                    ImagePlus imp = WindowManager.getImage(i);
104                    if (imp != null && imp != exclude) {
105                        imgList.add(imp);
106                    }
107                }
108        }
109        ImagePlus[] impArr = imgList.toArray(new ImagePlus[0]);
110        if (sortByTitle) {
111                Comparator<ImagePlus> cmp = new Comparator<ImagePlus>() {
112                        public int compare(ImagePlus impA, ImagePlus impB) {
113                                return impA.getTitle().compareTo(impB.getTitle());
114                        }
115                };
116                Arrays.sort(impArr, cmp);
117        }
118                return impArr;
119        }
120        
121
122        /**
123         *  Queries the user for an arbitrary file to be opened.
124         *  
125         * @param title string to be shown in the interaction window.
126         * @return path of the selected resource.
127         */
128        public static String askForOpenPath(String title) {
129                OpenDialog od = new OpenDialog(title, "");
130                String dir = od.getDirectory();
131                String name = od.getFileName();
132                if (name == null)
133                        return null;
134                return encodeURL(dir + name);
135        }
136        
137        private static String encodeURL(String url) {
138                //url = url.replaceAll(" ","%20");      // this doesn't work with spaces
139                url = url.replace('\\','/');
140                return url;
141        }
142        
143        //----------------------------------------------------------------------
144        
145
146        /**
147         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
148         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
149         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
150         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
151         * 
152         * @param title image title
153         * @param M 2D array
154         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} image
155         */
156        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, float[][] M) {
157                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
158                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
159                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
160                                fp.setf(u, v, M[v][u]);
161                        }
162                }
163                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
164        }
165        
166
167        /**
168         * Creates an ImageJ {@link ImagePlus} image for the matrix {@code M[r][c]} (2D array),
169         * where {@code r} is treated as the row (vertical) coordinate and
170         * {@code c} is treated as the column (horizontal) coordinate.
171         * Use {@code show()} to display the resulting image.
172         * 
173         * @param title the image title
174         * @param M a 2D array holding the image data
175         * @return a new {@link ImagePlus} instance
176         */
177        public static ImagePlus createImage(String title, double[][] M) {
178                FloatProcessor fp = new FloatProcessor(M[0].length, M.length);
179                for (int u = 0; u < M[0].length; u++) {
180                        for (int v = 0; v < M.length; v++) {
181                                fp.setf(u, v, (float) M[v][u]);
182                        }
183                }
184                return new ImagePlus(title, fp);
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
189         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
190         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
191         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
192         * {@link ColorProcessor}. Applies standard (ITU-709) weights.
193         * 
194         * @param ip The affected image
195         */
196        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip) {
197                setRgbConversionWeights(ip, 0.299, 0.587, 0.114);
198        }
199        
200        /**
201         * Sets the weighing factors for the color components used
202         * in RGB-to-grayscale conversion for the specified image {@code ip}.
203         * Note that this method can be applied to any {@link ImageProcessor}
204         * instance but has no effect unless {@code ip} is of type
205         * {@link ColorProcessor}.
206         * 
207         * @param ip The affected image
208         * @param wr Red weight
209         * @param wg Green weight
210         * @param wb Blue weight
211         */
212        public static void setRgbConversionWeights(ImageProcessor ip, double wr, double wg, double wb) {
213                if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor) {
214                        ((ColorProcessor) ip).setRGBWeights(wr, wg, wb);
215                }
216        }
217        
218        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
219        
220        /** 
221         * Returns a copy of the pixel data as a 2D double
222         * array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
223         * @param fp the image
224         * @return the resulting array
225         */
226        public static double[][] toDoubleArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
227                final int width = fp.getWidth();
228                final int height = fp.getHeight();
229                float[] fPixels = (float[]) fp.getPixels();
230                double[][] dPixels = new double[width][height];
231                int i = 0;
232                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
233                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
234                                dPixels[u][v] = fPixels[i];
235                                i++;
236                        }
237                }
238                return dPixels;
239        }
240        
241        /**
242         * Creates a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance of size width x height
243         * from the given 2D array with dimensions [x = 0..width-1][y = 0..height-1].
244         * 
245         * @param A a 2D {@code double} array
246         * @return a new {@link FloatProcessor} instance
247         */
248        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(double[][] A) {
249                final int width = A.length;
250                final int height = A[0].length;
251                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
252                int i = 0;
253                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
254                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
255                                fPixels[i] = (float) A[u][v];
256                                i++;
257                        }
258                }
259                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
260        }
261        
262        public static FloatProcessor toFloatProcessor(float[][] A) {
263                final int width = A.length;
264                final int height = A[0].length;
265                float[] fPixels = new float[width * height];
266                int i = 0;
267                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
268                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
269                                fPixels[i] = A[u][v];
270                                i++;
271                        }
272                }
273                return new FloatProcessor(width, height, fPixels);
274        }
275        
276        public static float[][] toFloatArray(FloatProcessor fp) {
277                final int w = fp.getWidth();
278                final int h = fp.getHeight();
279                float[][] A = new float[w][h];
280                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
281                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
282                                A[u][v] =  fp.getf(u, v);
283                        }
284                }
285                return A;
286        }
287        
288        /**
289         * Creates and returns a new {@code ByteProcessor} from
290         * the specified 2D {@code byte} array, assumed to be
291         * arranged in the form {@code A[x][y]}, i.e.,
292         * the first coordinate is horizontal, the second vertical.
293         * Thus {@code A.length} is the width and {@code A[0].length}
294         * the height of the resulting image.
295         * 
296         * @param A a 2D {@code byte} array
297         * @return a new {@code ByteProcessor} of size {@code A.length} x {@code A[0].length}
298         */
299        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(byte[][] A) {
300                final int w = A.length;
301                final int h = A[0].length;
302                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
303                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
304                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
305                                bp.putPixel(u, v, 0xFF & A[u][v]);
306                        }
307                }
308                return bp;
309        }
310        
311        public static byte[][] toByteArray(ByteProcessor bp) {
312                final int w = bp.getWidth();
313                final int h = bp.getHeight();
314                byte[][] A = new byte[w][h];
315                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
316                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
317                                A[u][v] =  (byte) (0xFF & bp.get(u, v));
318                        }
319                }
320                return A;
321        }
322        
323        public static ByteProcessor toByteProcessor(int[][] A) {
324                final int w = A.length;
325                final int h = A[0].length;
326                ByteProcessor bp = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
327                for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
328                        for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
329                                int val = A[u][v];
330                                if (val < 0)
331                                        val = 0;
332                                else if (val > 255) 
333                                        val = 255;
334                                bp.putPixel(u, v, val);
335                        }
336                }
337                return bp;
338        }
339        
340        /**
341         * Opens the image from the specified path and returns it
342         * as a {@link ImagePlus} instance.
343         * 
344         * @param path The simple name of the image file (including extension)
345         * @return A new {@link ImagePlus} instance or {@code null} if not found
346         */
347        public static ImagePlus openImage(Path path) {
348                Objects.requireNonNull(path);
349                return new Opener().openImage(path.toString());
350        }
351        
352        
353        // Methods for checking/comparing images (primarily used for testing)  ---------------------
354        
355        /**
356         * Checks if two images are of the same type.
357         * 
358         * @param ip1 the first image
359         * @param ip2 the second image
360         * @return true if both images have the same type
361         */
362        public static boolean sameType(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
363                return ip1.getClass().equals(ip2.getClass());
364        }
365        
366        /**
367         * Checks if two images have the same size.
368         * 
369         * @param ip1 the first image
370         * @param ip2 the second image
371         * @return true if both images have the same size
372         */
373        public static boolean sameSize(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
374                return ip1.getWidth() == ip2.getWidth() && ip1.getHeight() == ip2.getHeight();
375        }
376        
377        /**
378         * Checks if the given image is possibly a binary image. This requires that
379         * the image contains at most two different pixel values, one of which
380         * must be zero. All pixels are checked.
381         * This should work for all image types.
382         * More efficient implementations are certainly possible.
383         * 
384         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
385         * @return true if the image is binary
386         */
387        public static boolean isBinary(ImageProcessor ip) {
388                final int width = ip.getWidth();
389                final int height = ip.getHeight();
390                int fgVal = 0;
391                boolean binary = true;
392                
393                outer:
394                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
395                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
396                                int val = 0x007FFFFF & ip.get(u, v); // = mantissa in case of float
397                                if (val != 0) {
398                                        if (fgVal == 0) {       // first non-zero value
399                                                fgVal = val;
400                                        }
401                                        else if (val != fgVal) {        // found another non-zero value
402                                                binary = false;
403                                                break outer;
404                                        }
405                                }
406                        }
407                }
408                
409                return binary;
410        }
411        
412        /**
413         * Checks if the given image is "flat", i.e., all pixels have
414         * the same value.
415         * This should work for all image types.
416         * 
417         * @param ip the image ({@link ImageProcessor}) to be checked
418         * @return true if the image is flat
419         */
420        public static boolean isFlat(ImageProcessor ip) {
421                final int width = ip.getWidth();
422                final int height = ip.getHeight();
423                boolean flat = true;
424                int fgVal = ip.get(0, 0);
425                
426                outer:
427                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
428                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
429                                int val = ip.get(u, v);
430                                if (val != fgVal) {
431                                        flat = false;
432                                        break outer;
433                                }
434                        }
435                }
436                
437                return flat;
438        }
439        
440        public static final double DefaultMatchTolerance = 1E-6;
441        
442        /**
443         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
444         * {@link #DefaultMatchTolerance}).
445         * 
446         * @param ip1 the first image
447         * @param ip2 the second image
448         * @return true if both images have the same type and content
449         */
450        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2) {
451                return match(ip1, ip2, DefaultMatchTolerance);
452        }
453        
454        /**
455         * Checks if two images have the same type, size and content (using 
456         * the specified tolerance). 
457         * 
458         * @param ip1 the first image
459         * @param ip2 the second image
460         * @param tolerance the matching tolerance
461         * @return true if both images have the same type, size and content
462         */
463        public static boolean match(ImageProcessor ip1, ImageProcessor ip2, double tolerance) {
464                if (!sameType(ip1, ip2)) {
465                        return false;
466                }
467                if (!sameSize(ip1, ip2)) {
468                        return false;
469                }
470                
471                if (ip1 instanceof ByteProcessor) {
472                        byte[] p1 = (byte[]) ip1.getPixels();
473                        byte[] p2 = (byte[]) ip2.getPixels();
474                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
475                }
476                else if (ip1 instanceof ShortProcessor) {
477                        short[] p1 = (short[]) ip1.getPixels();
478                        short[] p2 = (short[]) ip2.getPixels();
479                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
480                }
481                else if (ip1 instanceof ColorProcessor) {
482                        int[] p1 = (int[]) ip1.getPixels();
483                        int[] p2 = (int[]) ip2.getPixels();
484                        return Arrays.equals(p1, p2);
485                }
486                
487                else if (ip1 instanceof FloatProcessor) {
488                        float[] p1 = (float[]) ip1.getPixels();
489                        float[] p2 = (float[]) ip2.getPixels();
490                        boolean same = true;
491                        final float toleranceF = (float) tolerance;
492                        for (int i = 0; i < p1.length; i++) {
493                                if (Math.abs(p1[i] - p2[i]) > toleranceF) {
494                                        same = false;
495                                        break;
496                                }
497                        }
498                        return same;
499                }
500
501                throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip1.getClass().getSimpleName());
502        }
503        
504        // BitMap from/to ByteProcessor conversion
505        
506        public static BitMap convertToBitMap(ByteProcessor bp) {
507                return new BitMap(bp.getWidth(), bp.getHeight(), (byte[]) bp.getPixels());
508        }
509
510        public static ByteProcessor convertToByteProcessor(BitMap bitmap) {
511                byte[] pixels = bitmap.getBitVector().toByteArray();
512                return new ByteProcessor(bitmap.getWidth(), bitmap.getHeight(), pixels);
513        }
514
515}
